channel.title: Acumatica-setup-and-configurations on Acumatica eCommerce Edition
channel.description: Recent content in Acumatica-setup-and-configurations on Acumatica eCommerce Edition

item.title: Creation of Item Sales Category
item.description:
2.1 Creation of Item Sales Category

Navigation: Distribution > Inventory > Configuration > Item Sales Categories

To create Item Sales Category

1. Select company

2. Click on plus button to add new category under default category.

3. Provide Description of the category. If you want to change the Parent Category then click on the selector and select anyone from the list. Under Category Members Table, you can map the products by clicking on plus button.

4. Click on “Ecommerce Tab”

5. Click on Product Sort By dropdown and select the value from the list to sort the category.

6. Click on Sync Status dropdown and select the value “Active” or “Inactive” to include or exclude the category during the Category Sync

7. Select the checkbox Include in Navigation Menu if the Category should be displayed in the navigation menu on Magento frontend.

8. Click on “Save” to save the configurations.

item.title: Creation of Attributes
item.description:
2.2 Creation of Attributes

Navigation: Configuration > Common Settings > Attributes

To Create Attributes

1. Click “plus” button and add Attribute ID

2. Add description Note: Attribute ID and Description should be the same

3. Select control type

4. In the below grid, click on “plus” and add Value ID, description (Both should be the same)

5. Click on “save”

item.title: Creation of Item Classes
item.description:
2.3 Creation of Item Classes

Navigation: Distribution > Inventory > Configuration > Item Classes

1. Click on Add button

2. Enter Class ID

3. Enter Description of the Class

4. Under General settings tab check “stock item” box

5. You may select the tax category or you can keep it empty. If tax category is mapped to product class then same tax will be applicable to all the products falling under theitem class.

6. Go to Attributes tab

7. Under attributes tab map the Attributes and check the Required box

8. Click on “Save”

item.title: Creation of Stock Item
item.description:
2.4 Creation of Stock Item

Navigation: Distribution > Inventory > Work Area > Stock Items

1. Enter Inventory ID

2. Select the item status as “Active”

3. Specify the description of the product

4. Under General settings select the item class for the product

5. Under Price/Cost tab define the Default price

6. Under Ecommerce Tab, check “Active” checkbox and select Visibility as “Catalog, Search” (this option is to make the product visible on the frontend in specific listing)

7. Under Attributes tab Add the attributes, Category/Categories and images of the product

8. Click on “Save”

item.title: Creation of Non Stock Item
item.description:
2.5 Creation of Non-Stock Items

Navigation: Distribution > Inventory > Work Area > Non Stock Items

Same as “Stock Item” creation. The only difference is, in Item classes under general settings tab, uncheck “stock Item“ checkbox.

Once above configuration is done, we can create the Non Stock items.

item.title: Adding Inventory – Receipts
item.description:
2.6 Adding Inventory – Receipts

Navigation: Distribution > Inventory > Work Area > Receipts

1. Uncheck the **“Hold”** checkbox

2. Under transaction details click on plus and add the details – Branch, Inventory ID, Warehouse, Location and Quantity

3. Click on Release option to release the inventory of respective item.

item.title: Creation of Customer
item.description:
2.7 Creation of Customer

Navigation: Finance > Accounts Receivable > Work Area > Customers

1. Enter customer ID

2. Enter customer name

3. Make the status to “Active” if you want to make the customer Active

4. Enter Main Contact details

5. Enter Main Address

6. Under Billing Address add the details or you can select check “Same as Main” box.

7. Under Delivery settings add the details or you can select check “Same as Main” box.

8. Click on “Save”

item.title: Configuring Processing Centers
item.description:
2.8 Configuring Processing Centers

Navigation: Finance > Cash Management > Configuration > Processing Centers

1. Enter Processing center ID

2. Enter Name

3. Select the Cash Account

4. Check “Active” checkbox

5. Select the Payment plug-in type

6. Under settings tab enter the credentials received after creating account on any of the Payment Method providers

item.title: Configuring Payment Methods (Cash/Check)
item.description:
2.9 Configuring Payment Methods (Cash/Check)

Navigation: Finance > Cash Management > Configuration > Payment Methods

1. Enter Payment Method ID

2. Check the **“Active”** checkbox

3. Select the means of payment

4. Enter description of the payment method

5. Check **“Use in AP”** and **“Use in AR”** checkboxes

6. Select the appropriate cash accounts under allowed **“Cash Accounts”** Tab

7. Under Settings for use in AR tab Check the Integrated Processing and Required Card/Account Number checkbox.

8. Under **“Processing Centers”** tab map the processing center to the **“Payment Method”**.

9. Click on **“Save”**

item.title: Configuring Carriers
item.description:
2.10 Configuring Carriers

Navigation: Distribution > Sales Orders > Configuration > Carriers

1. Enter Carrier ID

2. Enter Description

3. Select the Payment plug-in type

4. Select the UOM

5. Under the Plug-in Parameters enter the details in the fields shown with arrow.

item.title: configuring-boxes
item.description:
2.11 Configuring Boxes

Navigation: Distribution > Sales Orders > Configuration > Boxes

For configuring Boxes, enter the details for the fields marked with arrows and then click on “save”.

item.title: Configuring Ship via Codes
item.description:
2.12 Configuring Ship via Codes

Navigation: Distribution > Sales Orders > Configuration > Ship via Codes

1. Enter Ship via

2. Enter Description

3. Check “External plug-in” checkbox

4. Under “Details” tab select the Calendar, Carrier, Service method, Tax category, Freight Sales Account, Freight Sales sub account, select Freight Expense Account and add Freight Expense sub account.

5. Under packages tab add the Packages required / applicable for the selected Ship Via Codes

6. Click on “Save”
